result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevon Deonte Tyler

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Trevon Deonte Tyler in court, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Trevon Deonte Tyler.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Trevon Deonte Tyler.  Attorney Grant Ian Huebner in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Final Pretrial this date.  Defense requests adjourned as they need more time to investigate.  Defendant withdraws speedy trial demand.  No objection to adjournment by the State.  Parties advised any motions are to be filed by December 15, 2022.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 3, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for March 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Trevon Deonte Tyler in court with attorneys Mary Garvin Guimont and William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Trevon Deonte Tyler in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense requests final pretrial and jury trial.  
  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Trevon Deonte Tyler not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense requests adjourned date.  Parties agree via email to August 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  bm
Case calendared for Scheduling Conference July 14, 2022.  Attorney Guimont requests adjournment as she has jury duty.  Parties agree via email to July 12, 2022 at 1:30 pm.   bm
Scheduling conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Trevon Deonte Tyler not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defense counsel has filed Request for Substitution.

Court consented to substitution against Judge Sanders.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge D. Borowski, Branch 12.

Case is adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 12.

Clerk:  jms
Received and Filed. REQUEST FOR SUBSTITUTION OF JUDGE

Attorney Colin McGinn on behalf of Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Trevon Deonte Tyler not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference. Attorney of record not available due to personal issues. State informs the court that offer has not been turned at this time and that case may resolve. For reasons stated on the record, defense requests another scheduling conference date.  All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

09:49 AM Defendant Trevon Deonte Tyler in court by video with Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont who appears in person.  Defendant Trevon Deonte Tyler in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Fedel.  State rests. Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Trevon Deonte Tyler not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. Due to calendaring confusion Attorney Guimont had this matter set for 1:30pm. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Trevon Deonte Tyler in court, in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin on behalf of Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Trevon Deonte Tyler appeared by video means.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/
     99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea   

Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Tayon S.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $150,000.00 .  If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. Monitoring is 24 hour curfew.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Trevon Deonte Tyler in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Trevon Deonte Tyler in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
